preface.title: About This Guide
preface.para: In &productname;, there are several different high-level user roles:

listitem.para: Installs and deploys &productname; on bare-metal, then installs the operating system and the &ostack; components. For detailed information about the operator's tasks and how to solve them, refer to &cloud; &clouddeploy;.

Manages projects, users, images, flavors, and quotas within &productname;. For detailed information about the administrator's tasks and how to solve them, refer to the &ostack; &cloudadmin; and the &cloud; &cloudsuppl;.

End user who launches and manages instances, creates snapshots, and uses volumes for persistent storage within &productname;. For detailed information about the user's tasks and how to solve them, refer to &ostack; &clouduser; and the &cloud; &cloudsuppl;.

preface.para: This guide provides cloud operators with the information needed to deploy and maintain &cloud; administrative units, the &admserv;, the &contrnode;s, and the Compute and &stornode;s. The &admserv; provides all services needed to manage and deploy all other nodes in the cloud. The &contrnode; hosts all &ostack; components needed to operate virtual machines deployed on the &compnode;s in the &cloud;. Each virtual machine (&vmguest;) started in the cloud will be hosted on one of the &compnode;s. Object storage is managed by the &stornode;s.
Many chapters in this manual contain links to additional documentation resources. These include additional documentation that is available on the system, and documentation available on the Internet.
